title: > > so if I understand, it is:
body:
> > so if I understand, it is:
> > 
> > 1. download dfl rtx 3000 folder from mega in github.
> > 2. download and install cuda 11.0 + 11.1 update, and CUDNN 11.1
> > 3. install cuda and CUDNN
> > 4. Move all DLLs from CUDA and CUDNN bin folders from install location to CUDA and CUDNN within DFL internal folder.
> > 
> > am I missing anything?
> 
> install cuda 11.1
> 
> download cudnn 8 04 30
> 
> then:
> 
> Installing cuDNN On Windows
> 
> Copy the following files into the CUDA Toolkit directory.
> Copy \cuda\bin\cudnn*.dll to C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\vx.x\bin.
> Copy \cuda\include\cudnn*.h to C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\vx.x\include.
> Copy \cuda\lib\x64\cudnn*.lib to C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\vx.x\lib\x64.
> 
> that's it
> 
> sometimes on the training's first run it will seem like it's stuck, but it goes after a few minutes.

thank you, that got it working. I was moving the CUDA and cudnn files from their origin to the deepfake internal folder, rather than to the program files cuda folders. Is there any reason to add any of the DLLs to the internal folder?

_Originally posted by @mnewxcv in https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/issues/906#issuecomment-720798680_

need to add tensorflow 2.4.0 rc to all this stuff?
